title: EastEnders spoilers: Callum saves Whitney from evil Leo?
text:
Since returning from her honeymoon-for-one, Whitney Dean (Shona McGarty) has been enjoying a whirlwind romance with Leo King (Tom Wells) in EastEnders. Unbeknownst to her, Leo is the son of paedophile Tony (Chris Coghill) who abused her a decade ago, so it’s clear the young man’s intentions are anything but honourable. However, could ex-fiancé Callum ‘Halfway’ Highway (Tony Clay) be the one to save her?

After spending the night with Ben (Max Bowden), Callum came clean to Whitney the day before the pair’s wedding. Understandably, Whitney was left heartbroken, but she ultimately resolved to carry on with the wedding, However, when its came the time to say ‘I do’, she was unable to do so, and thus told Callum that both of them deserve better than second best.

Following this, Bianca (Patsy Palmer) persuaded her to jet off on her honeymoon by herself and — with a couple of weeks away to gather her thoughts — Whitney returned home, and opened up to Tiffany (Maisie Smith) about her new whirlwind romance. It soon came to light that her new fella was none other than Leo — the son of paedophile Tony King, who abused Whitney when she was younger.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The young man is evidently out for revenge, and with his plan well and truly set in motion, Whitney is in serious danger. However, could Callum perhaps be the one to rescue her from the villainous lad’s evil plan?

In the coming episodes, Whitney is left upset when her stall is vandalised, and — never one to miss an opportunity — Leo comes to her aid. However, in spite of him attempting to behave like a gentleman, he’s soon left disgruntled, as he realises that Callum could well be a thorn in his side — as the presence of Whitney’s ex could end up spoiling his plan to get close to her.

In spite of their history, Whitney and Callum have begun to build a friendship, so could the young lad prove instrumental in Leo’s downfall?

If there’s one thing we know about Callum, it’s that he cares for Whitney, so should he get wind of what Leo’s really like, then he could end up saving her from the evil man.

One to watch: Tuesday 22nd October at 7:30pm on BBC One.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Will Callum come to Whitney's rescue?
